The year is 2050 and ITP now has a sister program at NYUM (NYU Mars). The first Mars-born students (born in 2030) are entering the program. Given what you know about the predicted constraints of living and attending university on Mars, please share your thoughts about the work these students will produce, and show some imaginary examples of their ITP projects.
Imagine that all the ITP student work represents the DNA of a university program. Describe a university program based on this DNA.
Based on the archive, develop one representative work for each year of ITP’s history.
Create prompts based on the entry requirements of various art shows and have Chat ITP create work for these shows.
Design the 'ITP version' of these common objects: Toaster, bubble tea, supercomputer, paper clip, pet chihuahua, underpants.
What were the project trends in the 2004 ITP?
What will the project trends be in the 2077 ITP?
What are some of the topics of ITP projects lost in history?
Develop detailed documentation for a potential project that meets this week’s assignment requirements.
How did ITP projects evolve in terms of multimedia storytelling from the 2000s to the 2010s?
Describe the most innovative ITP projects from the 1980s that utilized early computer graphics.
What features were most prominent among ITP VR projects in the last decade?
How did cultural factors affect ITP projects in the 1970s?
How have ITP projects addressed environmental sustainability?
Consider if ITP was established in a different country or cultural context. How might the projects and focus areas vary from those in New York?
Think about creating a 2024 ITP class time capsule. What items would you include to represent the projects, technologies, and culture of this year? How might students in 2050 react to these items?
How to create a VR project that allows users to experience key moments and projects from ITP's history.
Examine the evolution of interface design in ITP projects from the 2000s to now. Identify major trends and influential projects.
Construct an escape room that showcases the skills and creativity of ITP students. What puzzles and technologies would you incorporate?
What would a collaboration between Ziyuan Lin and Yuxiang Cheng look like?
What is a past ITP project similar to this project: <detail of a project>?
What is a past ITP project similar to the video game Outer Wilds?
If an ITP project uses a quantum computer, what would it look like?
Give me an example of two past ITP projects that are similar to each other but created 20 years apart.
Write an advertisement poem about ITP Spring Show.
What is the most common theme explored by ITP people?
Create a prompt for the ITP community to ponder today. Look up relevant articles and news.
Tell me about the most groundbreaking projects made by ITP.
Create a project outline for the prompt you created. Consider aspects such as novelty, motivation and thinking in your response.
In 2075, ITP students will use AR to redefine social interactions. Describe a project and its implications on privacy and connections.
ITP collaborates with environmental scientists on climate change projects. Detail a project using innovative tech to tackle an environmental issue and engage the public.
Design a 2050 ITP classroom with AI tutors, holographic displays, and VR. Describe a session focusing on a complex topic.
ITP on a floating ocean city focuses on sustainability and marine research. Describe three projects on ocean conservation, sustainable architecture, and renewable energy.
ITP collaborates with indigenous communities, blending traditional knowledge with modern tech. Describe a project that benefits both the community and society.
